FuncDef:
The set pm-inputvoltage command configures the power modules (PMs) of a device with flexible power distribution to use 110 V input voltage in a single-chassis or multi-chassis  scenario.
The undo set pm-inputvoltage command restores the default configuration in a single-chassis or multi-chassis  scenario.
By default, the PMs of a device with flexible power distribution are not configured to use 110 V input voltage.

ParaDef.Info:
Configures the PMs of a device with flexible power distribution to use 110 V input voltage.
-

Specifies the ID of a registered chassis.
The value is a string of 1 to 64 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported. It must start with an uppercase or lowercase letter.

Examples: Warning: This operation may cause power-on failures for newly inserted boards! Continue? [Y/N]:y
Info: Set pm input voltage to 110V successfully.
Warning: This operation may cause power-on failures for newly inserted boards! Continue? [Y/N]:y
Error: Current power supply configuration does not support to set the input voltage of pm to 110V.
Warning: This operation may cause power-on failures for newly inserted boards! Continue? [Y/N]:y
Info: Set pm input voltage to 110V successfully.
Warning: This operation may cause power-on failures for newly inserted boards! Continue? [Y/N]:y
Error: Current power supply configuration does not support to set the input voltage of pm to 110V.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
If external power supply resources are limited, run the set pm-inputvoltage command to configure the PMs of a device with flexible power distribution to use 110 V input voltage. In this way, the device can work properly in the 110 V input scenario, with the rated power of each PM being reduced by half.
